result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs, fees & surcharges; to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds/ earnings.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant to enter into a monthly payment plan.
Concurrent with: with Waukesha County case 10CF772

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearm and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment/ counseling.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, calendar successor, for review. spc
Count 1.

**MATTER BEFORE THE COURT FOR INITIAL APPEARANCE**
Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Eric D Ward not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for hearing.  Upon further reflection of the docket, parties advised the initial appearance was not conducted by Branch 7 upon the findings of competency at the return of doctor's report hearing on 6/30/15.    Defense counsel advised the court she had reviewed the criminal complaint several times with the defendant throughout the proceedings.  Court found probable cause without objection from the parties.  Court finds the defendant intended to enter a guilty plea on 1/22/16 and the court accepted the guilty plea on that date.  Court ordered the sentence imposed on 1/22/16 remain of record.  Court took no further action.
Per Court, this matter needs to be rescheduled as an initial appearance was never completed. Parties notified. Case adjourned to 1/25/16 at 1:30 p.m. for Hearing in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Eric D Ward in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Eric D Ward in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred to the Honorable Stephanie Rothstein.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-22-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Eric D Ward not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not able to proceed to plea and sentencing today. Defense counsel is requesting discovery. Court orders State to provide discovery being requested by the end of the month (10/30/15). Defense counsel to notify the Court if discovery is not turned over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Eric D Ward not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is not prepared to proceed to plea today, but matter remains in resolution posture.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Eric D Ward not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel request plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 07/10/2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont, 819 N. 6th, 9th FL, Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Eric D Ward not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse. Case remains calendared in Branch 07.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Eric D Ward in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Eric D Ward in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to prior conviction of the defendant in Waukesha County case #10CF772 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice 2000 for mental health assessment/treatment referral.

Defendant Eric D Ward in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Eric D Ward in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reinstates proceedings.    Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 07-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Eric D Ward not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for return on doctors report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report received and filed.

Defendant Eric D Ward in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Eric D Ward in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. 
 Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
